title: Faculty Senate Records
finding_aid_title: Finding Aid for the Faculty Senate Records

content: This collection houses memoranda, reports, minutes, membership information, resolutions, by-laws, and other materials documenting the activities of the University of Tennessee's Faculty Senate between 1947 and 1975.
notes.label: Abstract

subnotes.content: Collections are stored offsite, and a minimum of 24 hours is needed to retrieve these items for use. Researchers interested in consulting any of the collections are advised to contact Special Collections.
The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.
[Identification of Item], Faculty Senate Records, AR.0011. University of Tennessee, Knoxville, Special Collections Library.
These records are the property of the University of Tennessee's Archives.

The University of Tennessee's Faculty Senate was formally organized in 1949 as the growing number of faculty made it nearly impossible to hold meetings of the general faculty. The group was reorganized in 1972 and is currently empowered to design curriculum to support the University's overall educational goals and to advise the President on matters affecting the University's faculty. It is also a charter member of the Tennessee University Faculty Senates, which is designed to increase communication between the Senates at the various campuses and enable UT faculty to lobby effectively at the state level.

This collection houses memoranda, reports, minutes, membership information, resolutions, by-laws, and other materials documenting the activities of the University of Tennessee's Faculty Senate between 1947 and 1975.
This collection consists of three boxes.
